activities.loc: Br 9 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim S.C (person, property, residence or family). No contact with the co-defendant.

2:02 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerome M Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alexia Gianitsos appeared by video for Jerome M Johnson. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
